name: Clifton Chenier
description:
'''Clifton Chenier''' (June 25, 1925 â€“ December 12, 1987), was an American musician known as a pioneer of [[zydeco]], a style of music that arose from [[Creole music]], with [[rhythm and blues|R&B]], [[blues]], and [[Cajun music|Cajun]] influences. He sang and played the [[accordion]]. Chenier won a [[Grammy Award]] in 1983.

Chenier was known as the King of Zydeco, and also billed as the King of the South.
